body.name: HyperX Vision S – Webcam, 4K Video Recording @ 30fps, 90° Field-of-View, Responsive Autofocus, Hyperflex Cable, Aluminum Body, Plug and Play, Sony Starvis 8MP Sensor, 5G2P Lens, USB-C – Black

features: High-Quality 4K Video Recording @ 30fps: Upgrade to 4K video recording at 30fps thanks to the Sony STARVIS 8-megapixel sensor. You’ll also get more clarity, great low-light performance, and less light distortion with the premium glass lens.
90° Field-of-View with Responsive Autofocus: With a wide 90° field of view, you can capture more of your surroundings while the responsive autofocus keeps the focus on you.
Keep Private Moments Private: Put a physical barrier between you and prying eyes with the included magnetic privacy cover and an LED indicator to let you know when the camera’s active.
Swivel and Tilt for Adjustments: Make sure you’ve got everything set up just right. The HyperX Vision S can swivel and tilt to allow you to capture everything at your desired camera angle.
Durable Aluminum Body: HyperX Vision S features a tough aluminum body and a scratch-resistant 5G2P lens.
body.description: Let your talents be seen in stunning clarity with the HyperX Vision S Webcam. With 4K recording capabilities and an 8-megapixel Sony StarvisTM IMX415 sensor, the HyperX Vision S is built for creators who put a lot of care into their creations’ visuals. It’s capable of capturing a 90º field of view to take in more of your surroundings and can capture it all in 4K at 30fps and go up to 60fps for 1080p. Responsive autofocus capabilities combined with a low-distortion glass lens help you stay in focus while it takes in all those additional details. The included magnetic privacy cover and LED indicator help defend your privacy, putting a physical barrier between you and would-be prying eyes. A universal clip mount with a ¼” mounting point make setting up this USB camera a simple task. Durable and built to last, this camera features a glass lens, aluminum body, and the detachable, ultra-flexible HyperFlex Cable. Get everything looking just right with HyperX NGENUITY Software. Adjust picture settings like contrast, saturation, white-balance, and anti-flicker, as well as camera settings like exposure, zoom, and low-light compensation in the easy-to-use software. The HyperX Vision S camera is compatible with PC and Mac systems, Windows Hello Certified, and works with recording and meeting platforms like Teams, Zoom, OBS, and Discord.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 4K Video Recording at 30fps Sony STARVIS 8-megapixel sensor. Clarity, great low-light performance, and less light distortion with the premium glass lens. 90° FOV with Autofocus With a wide 90° field of view, you can capture more of your surroundings while the responsive autofocus keeps the focus on you. Keep Private Moments Private Manage privacy with the included magnetic privacy cover and an LED indicator to let you know when the camera’s active. Swivel and Tilt Adjustments The HyperX Vision S can swivel and tilt to allow you to capture everything at your desired camera angle.

Flexible, Detachable Cable The flexible HyperFlex Cable is a 1.8m cable that resists snagging and detaches for easy clean-up and transport. Durable Aluminum Body HyperX Vision S features a tough aluminum body and a scratch-resistant 5G2P lens. Easy Plug and Play Setup Plug in the USB connector and you’re ready to go! Compatible with Mac or PC. Windows Hello Certified, works with Zoom, Discord, OBS, and Teams. Adjust with HyperX NGENUITY Tune settings like saturation, white-balance, and anti-flicker, as well as camera settings like exposure, gain, and low-light compensation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A High-Def Showstopper for Creators
reviews.reviewText: The HyperX Vision S webcam isn't just another face in the crowd. It's a 4K powerhouse aimed at streamers, content creators, and anyone who wants to take their video calls to the next level. After putting it through its paces, here's my verdict:Sharp as a Tack: The star of the show is undoubtedly the 8MP Sony Starvis sensor. 4K recording at 30fps is crisp and clear, capturing fine details with impressive accuracy. Even in 1080p at 60fps, the picture remains smooth and vibrant. Low-light performance is commendable too, thanks to the sensor's light sensitivity.Wide Enough for Everyone: No more cropping out your teammates or squeezing into the frame. The 90° field of view is a game-changer, showcasing your entire setup or capturing more background context in your streams. It's perfect for presentations, group calls, and showcasing your creative workspace.Focus on Point: Autofocus is fast and accurate, keeping you sharp even if you're constantly moving around. No more blurry faces or fidgeting to stay in focus. This is especially helpful for streamers and educators who need to be dynamic on camera.Built to Last: The HyperX Vision S feels premium, with a sleek aluminum body and a sturdy yet flexible HyperFlex cable. It's a welcome departure from flimsy plastic webcams that feel like they'll break at the slightest touch. The magnetic privacy cover is a nifty addition for extra peace of mind.Plug and Play Perfection: True to its name, the Vision S is instantly ready to go. No drivers, no fuss – just plug it in and start streaming. This ease of use extends to the HyperX NGENUITY software, where you can fine-tune settings like white balance, exposure, and even adjust the field of view to your liking.Minor Nitpicks: While the audio quality is decent, it doesn't quite match the video. If you rely heavily on voice, a dedicated microphone might be a better option. Also, the lack of a built-in tripod mount might be a minor inconvenience for some users.Verdict: The HyperX Vision S delivers on its promises. It's a premium webcam that offers exceptional video quality, a generous field of view, and a user-friendly experience. While the price tag might be a bit steeper than some budget options, the build quality, performance, and feature set justify it for creators and serious video-callers. If you're looking for a webcam that elevates your online presence, the HyperX Vision S is a top contender.I recommend the HyperX Vision S to:Streamers and content creators who value high-quality video captureProfessionals who want to impress in video calls and presentationsAnyone who wants a durable and feature-rich webcam for everyday video communicationIf you're on a tight budget or don't need the extra features, a more basic webcam might be sufficient. But for those who demand the best, the HyperX Vision S is definitely worth considering.I hope this review helps you decide if the HyperX Vision S is the right webcam for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars an amazing camera. Great picture quality and portability
reviews.reviewText: Have previously used HyperX products so I have some expectations with this camera. However, the camera actually exceeded my expectation.What I like:- Well built. It is a heavy camera. The whole body is constructed with aluminum. It is here to last.- Quite small folded down. I originally planned on having the camera stationed at my desk. However, seeing how small it actually folds down to, I have brought it with me to the office (in a tight pouch, as the magnetic cover would fall off otherwise) and it didn't take up much space in my bag.- Picture quality. Picture is crisp and sharp. Auto-focus sometimes does take a split second to adjust but overall very quick and smooth. The picture/video looks great on both 1080@60 and 4K@30. I have some "4K" cameras that barely function at 4K setting (granted those cameras were way cheaper), so I'm extremely pleased with the picture quality.- Good quality usb cable. The usb cable is braided nylon instead of the typical plastic ones. This gives a nice touch to the overall camera package.- Magnetic cover. The magnetic cover makes it much easier to switch between privacy and without. What's more, you can "stick" the cover at the back of the webcam when not in use.What I didn't like:- usb-A connector. I would prefer a usb-c with a usb-A adapter, as my macbook pro only comes with usb-c ports while my home setup has usb-A ports as well.- price tag. This is a great quality camera, so I expected the price tag to be higher than alot other ones. However, at time of review, it's priced at $200. It's a bit high since there are a few name brand webcams with similiar specs priced way lower.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A step above
reviews.reviewText: This is a webcam with advanced features. The camera measures 4.5” long by 1.75”x1.75”. It is relatively heavy compared to typical standalone webcams that I have tried. It has a trifold base that will perch on top of a monitor. The base has a ¼” tripod mount as well. The cord has braided insulation throughout. The cord terminates in a standard USB A plug. The camera has a built in microphone as well as autofocus features. It comes with a built-in magnetic lens privacy cover that fits on the back of the camera when not in use.I am quite impressed with the image quality produced by this camera. I have tried at least 6-8 webcams over the years. This one leads the rest, with its high definition image quality and great built-in microphone. The camera focus within a second of being turned on and is then spot on—no remote needed. If you move around the room, the camera refocuses on your face automatically, although it doesn’t pan with you. The microphone sounds better than the dedicated microphone that I usually use. I also like that this camera is truly plug and play, with no learning curve. Just plug it in, and turn on Zoom or your favorite video recording software, and you’re good to go. Overall, this is a well-built easy-to-use camera for when image quality is paramount..
